title: commitment
comment: A state of personal dedication to something or someone, which results in actively promoting and working for their good and well-being.

children.title: commitment, to God
children.comment: Commitment to God arises from faith in his promises, is expressed in worship and adoration and leads to obedience to his commands.

children.title: Commitment to God commanded
Obedience to God's commands as a sign of commitment

seealsos.comment: The reference may be to the ear-piercing that was a sign of slaves' voluntary commitment to their masters

children.title: Love for God and worship of him are hallmarks of commitment
Benefits of commitment to God
Examples of commitment to God

secondaryrefs.comment: the tribes who settled in Transjordan

children.title: God's commitment of gifts and tasks to his people
God's commitment of gifts
God's commitment of the faith to believers
commitment, to Jesus Christ
children.comment: Commitment to Jesus Christ is grounded in the knowledge of his saving power and divinity, and expresses itself in adoration and obedience to Jesus Christ.

children.title: Jesus Christ commanded people to make the commitment to follow him

seealsos.comment: There may have been a ``Christ-party'' at Corinth, or in contrast with the sectarianism, Paul may be asserting his own commitment to Jesus Christ.

children.title: Jesus Christ frequently spelt out the cost of commitment to him
Jesus Christ's demand for commitment was sometimes met with a refusal
Sometimes people followed Jesus Christ without being truly committed to him

primaryrefs.comment: This would have been true for many in the crowds.

children.title: Some committed themselves wholeheartedly to his invitation
Secret commitment to Jesus Christ
True commitment to Jesus Christ is seen in love and obedience to him

primaryrefs.comment: In response to who Jesus Christ is and what he has done.

children.title: commitment, to God's people
children.comment: Commitment to God means a commitment to his people. Believers are meant to be nourished and supported by the church, and to work towards its edification.

children.title: Commitment to the church
Commitment to other Christians is an expression of love made known in Christ
Such commitment is expressed in mutual responsibility and concern

seealsos.comment: Paul's concern for unity among believers
the responsibility of believers to forgive one another

children.title: For its leaders, commitment to the church may prove a joy and a burden

primaryrefs.comment: Paul speaking to the elders of the church at Ephesus

children.title: commitment, to the world
children.comment: Though the world is fallen, God still loves the world and is committed to it. Commitment by believers to worldly pursuits and evil is to be avoided as they are called upon to be ``in the world'' but ``not of the world''.

children.title: Commitment to this world to be avoided because it is a fallen and sinful place
Though the world is fallen, God still loves it
Preoccupation with the things of this world is incompatible with holy living
Commitment to the world is seen especially in materialism
The outcome of worldly commitment
Spiritual loss
God's judgment
Carelessness with regard to Jesus Christ's return
